The Timing Framework is a set of utility classes that enables you to create powerful animations in your Java applications.

See:
          Description

Packages
org.jdesktop.animation.timing Core classes of the Timing Framework; these classes provide the base functionality that all animations will use.
org.jdesktop.animation.timing.interpolation Provides a mechanism for animating object properties between different values.
org.jdesktop.animation.timing.triggers Provides simple mechanism for starting Animators when specific events occur.

 

The Timing Framework is a set of utility classes that enables you to create powerful animations in your Java applications.

The Timing Framework was implemented by Chet Haase and introduced in the book Filthy Rich Clients (Haase and Guy, Addison-Wesley, 2008).

This "classic" version of the Timing Framework has the API described Filthy Rich Clients. It is not actively maintained and is only provided only as a historical curio for folks who are trying out the examples in the book.

DO NOT USE THIS VERSION FOR NEW DEVELOPMENT!

Why? Newer releases of the library solve a problem with the Swing timer that was discussed in Chet's JavaOne 2008 talk, are multi-thread safe, go faster, use less memory, support both Swing and SWT, and have an improved API.
